translation: Next, he explains the ritual for the accomplishment of the great vajra-scented bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 如前持誦大明八千遍精熟已。
translation: After reciting the great incense 8,000 times as before, he recites it intently.
Then, he recites the incense and applies the calming scent.
Whenever he burns the smoke of this incense and comes in contact with someone, he'll be able to fall asleep and cause them to speak of good and bad qualities.
They'll be able to awaken and cause others to speak of good and evil.

source_sentence: 若有天人及藥叉等所魅者悉能解除。
translation: If there are any celestials or yakṣas who are haunted by them, they'll be able to remove them.

source_sentence: 乃至不淨鬼及作熱病瘧病小小鬼等所執持者。
translation: Even impure ghosts and those held by small children who contract fever and malaria.
A little recitation of the great teaching will quickly remove them.
If he wants to cause them all to enter awakening.
He must also form a boundary to protect himself.
He must also shield those who enter into wakefulness.

source_sentence: 所有諸惡星曜作災害者。
translation: All those bad stars and celestial beings that cause harm will quickly recede.
Reciting this great dhāraṇī will also quickly set them free.
It's a spell that accomplishes one's own goals and stops others.

source_sentence: 所有一切難事皆得成就。
translation: All difficult tasks are accomplished.
This great luminosity has the power to do as he wishes.
"Furthermore, suppose there's a practitioner who wants to perform various accomplishment spells.
They want to do things that accomplish the Dharma.

source_sentence: 行人潔淨常食赤色飲食。
translation: The practitioner cleanses himself and always eats a red-colored diet.
Then, he prepares various kinds of flowers and incense.
He makes offerings to the Buddha and the original honored ones.
He starts with the first day of the white moon.

source_sentence: 滿七晝夜誦大明滿八千遍。
translation: For seven full days and nights, he recites the great luminosity 8,000 times.
After making the invocation, he recites it.

source_sentence: 此後一切所作皆得成就。
translation: All subsequent actions will be accomplished.
Those who want to pay respect to them should call their name and recite the great insight.

source_sentence: 當稱彼名誦大明即獲敬愛。
translation: He should call his name, recite the great teaching, and then he'll be adored.

source_sentence: 若誦大明八千遍加持白芥子。
translation: If you recite the great teaching 8,000 times and bless a white mustard seed, then you'll be honored when you touch it with the mustard seed.
Anyone who touches it with the mustard seed will be adored.

source_sentence: 若誦大明八千遍加持麥。

Those who touch it with a khadira will be honored.
If someone wants a Brāhmaṇa to be loved, they must recite the 8,000 recitations of the great teaching and apply it to wheat.

source_sentence: 誦大明八千遍加持炭灰。
translation: Recite the great teaching 8,000 times and bless charcoal ashes with it.
Scattering it among the brāhmaṇas will make them adore it.

source_sentence: 若誦大明八千遍加持油。
translation: If he recites the great teaching 8,000 times and adds oil to it, then he'll be loved by the Vaiśravaṇa.
Give it to Vaiśravaṇa, and he'll venerate it.

source_sentence: 若誦大明八千遍加持鹽。
translation: If he recites the great teaching 8,000 times and adds salt to it, he'll be loved by those who give it to Śuddhâvāsa.
Give it to Śuddhâvāsa, and he'll honor it.

It'll make wood for your teeth and last a year.
He'll then attain honesty in everything he says.
They won't speak harshly.
If a soldier recites the words of the great teaching seven times.
When he blesses the hair on his head, he'll enter battle and be victorious.

source_sentence: 若誦大明加持白芥子作護摩者。
translation: If he recites the great teaching and blesses a white mustard seed to use as a guard, he'll attain respect for all [sentient beings].
He'll attain respect and affection from everyone.

source_sentence: 若誦大明加持脂麻作護摩者。
translation: If he recites the great teaching and applies hemp as a guard and moisturizer, he'll attain all kinds of rewards.
He'll attain all kinds of prosperity.

source_sentence: 若誦大明加持酥作護摩者。
translation: If he recites the words of the Great Luminosity and adds butter as a guard and moisturizer, he'll be able to stop all calamities.
He'll be able to stop all calamities.

source_sentence: 若誦大明加持乳作護摩者。
translation: If he recites the great teaching and imparts milk as a guard and moat, he'll cause cattle, horses, and other animals to become free of all calamities.

source_sentence: 當令牛馬及諸畜等無諸瘴疫。
translation: It will make cattle, horses, and other animals free of pestilence.'

A practitioner who wants to contemplate the character's form.

source_sentence: 先立身作右舞勢心住三昧。
translation: First, he stands up and makes a right-hand dance gesture while his mind abides in samādhi.

source_sentence: 以二手作金剛鉤安於心上。
translation: He uses his second hand to make a vajra hook and places it over his mind.

source_sentence: 此是金剛香菩薩常相印。
translation: This is the Vajragarbha bodhisattva's sign of constancy.

source_sentence: 若欲觀根本大明字莊嚴者。
translation: If he wants to observe the adornment of the radical and great luminous letters, he should observe the Vajra-incense Bodhisattva.
You should observe the Vajra-permeating Bodhisattva.

Using eight hundred heaps of butter, he recites the great luminosity.
This accomplishes the task of guarding and moistening.

source_sentence: 此法可使三界之內一切皆令入寤。
translation: This method will cause everything within the three realms to awaken.
They'll come to live in space.

source_sentence: 說於過去未來現在之事。
translation: He'll explain past, future, and present events.

source_sentence: 又或以瞿摩夷塗四方曼拏羅。
translation: Another thing is to paint a four-square maṇḍala with gomaya.
At the four corners, he places bowls for birth.
In the center, he places images.
Perhaps it's a ghaṭī vase or a bell.

source_sentence: 磨赤檀塗像身及鈴等已。
translation: After rubbing red sandalwood over the body of the images and the bells, etc., they burn incense for repose and recite the great incantation.

source_sentence: 然後燒安息香誦大明千遍。
translation: Then he burns a scent of calming incense and recites the great teaching a thousand times.
The bells and so forth then fall asleep.

source_sentence: 然後更結金剛印作忿怒相。
translation: Then, he puts on the vajra mudrā and makes a wrathful sign.
He recites the Sanskrit phoneme un in a loud voice.

source_sentence: 即時虛空中有聲說三世之事。
translation: There's then a voice in the sky that explains the events of the three times.
Suppose he burns the incense of turuṣka.
He recites the fundamental great teaching a thousand times.
It's like reciting a river or a large mountain.
They can be shaken and made to appear awake.
Suppose he places a skull in a maṇḍala.
The practitioner recites the great luminosity a thousand times.

source_sentence: 燒安息香作忿怒相高聲誦吽字。
translation: Burning an incense burner, he makes a wrathful face and recites the Sanskrit phoneme un in a loud voice.

source_sentence: 髑髏即入寤起離曼拏羅。
translation: The skull then rises from the waking state and leaves the maṇḍala.
He'll stand in space and explain good and bad things.
Again, he'll go to a place where there's a cloister.

source_sentence: 以不墮地瞿摩夷塗曼拏羅。
translation: He coats the maṇḍala with Gomaya that doesn't fall to the ground.
He burns a scent of benzoin in the center of it.
He recites the great teaching 1,000 times over.

source_sentence: 行人作忿怒相結忿怒印。
translation: The practitioner makes angry faces and puts on the seal of wrath.

source_sentence: 以金剛杵擊伏藏之地伏藏自現。
translation: Striking the place of ambrosia with a vajra hammer, the ambrosia will naturally appear.

source_sentence: 佛說金剛香菩薩大明成就儀軌經卷中
translation: Foshuo jingangxiang pusa damingcheng yigui jing roll zhong
